title: David Holoubek
text:
David Holoubek (born 8 June 1980) is a Czech <a href="association%20football">football</a> manager who is currently the manager of <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Czech Republic U19</a>.
Career.
Early career.
In his player career he played in 3rd Czech league.
His manager career started in <a href="Humpolec">Humpolec</a>. He moved to <a href="Prague">Prague</a> in 2004 for study sport in <a href="Charles%20University">Charles University</a>.
Sparta Prague.
During his study he started in Sparta Prague as assistant in U15 team. As assistant of Petr Janoušek he trained <a href="Ladislav%20Krej%C4%8D%C3%AD">Ladislav Krejčí</a>, <a href="Ji%C5%99%C3%AD%20Skal%C3%A1k">Jiří Skalák</a> or <a href="Pavel%20Kade%C5%99%C3%A1bek">Pavel Kadeřábek</a>.
In 2012, he became head coach at Sparta's U19 team.
In season 2015/16 Sparta U19 won Czech 1st junior league.
In June 2016 he became assistant of <a href="Zden%C4%9Bk%20%C5%A0%C4%8Dasn%C3%BD">Zdeněk Ščasný</a> in Sparta's A-team (he was still coach of U19).
In September 2016 head coach Ščasný was fired after losing the <a href="Prague%20derby">Prague derby</a> against city rivals <a href="Slavia%20Prague">Slavia Prague</a> with Holoubek becoming acting head coach. Due to not holding a <a href="UEFA%20Pro%20Licence">UEFA Pro Licence</a>, his tenure was limited to two months. In November 2016 he was formally replaced by <a href="Zden%C4%9Bk%20Svoboda">Zdeněk Svoboda</a>. On 21 December 2016 Sparta announced that club sport director <a href="Tom%C3%A1%C5%A1%20Po%C5%BE%C3%A1r">Tomáš Požár</a> became head coach and Holoubek first coach. After a poor run of results in March 2017, the whole coaching team was dissolved and Holoubek returned to Sparta's U17 team.
In June 2017 he announced on his <a href="Twitter">Twitter</a> account that he became an owner of UEFA Pro Licence.
Slovan Liberec.
On 22 December 2017 Holoubek signed a contract with <a href="FC%20Slovan%20Liberec">FC Slovan Liberec</a>. In his coaching squad are former players <a href="Miroslav%20Hole%C5%88%C3%A1k">Miroslav Holeňák</a>, <a href="Ji%C5%99%C3%AD%20Jaro%C5%A1%C3%ADk">Jiří Jarošík</a> and goalkeeper <a href="Marek%20%C4%8Cech%20%28Czech%20footballer%29">Marek Čech</a>.
Ružomberok.
On 4 June 2018 Holoubek signed a contract with <a href="MFK%20Ru%C5%BEomberok">MFK Ružomberok</a>.
Czech Republic national team U18.
In February 2020 Holoubek became a manager of <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20under-18%20football%20team">Czech Republic U18</a>.
Czech Republic national team.
On 6 September 2020, it was announced that Holoubek would take charge of the <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20football%20team">Czech Republic national team</a> in their match against <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a> on the following day, as the entire squad and coaching staff which played against <a href="Slovakia%20national%20football%20team">Slovakia</a> on 4 September had to be replaced due to positive <a href="Severe%20acute%20respiratory%20syndrome%20coronavirus%202">SARS-CoV-2</a> tests.
